alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 11 at 8:12PM MDT until April 16 at 10:42AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Jemez River Above Jemez Pueblo affecting Sandoval County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. Overbank flooding is likely to begin within the next 48 hours. Further rises could lead impacts on bridges and low-lying roads. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Jemez River above Jemez Pueblo. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Significant overbank flows are occurring from above Jemez Springs down through the Jemez Pueblo. Further rises will result in bridges becoming unsafe to cross in and around Jemez Springs. At 10.0 feet, Widespread overbank flooding is occurring. Bridges in and around Jemez Springs are either impassable or unsafe to cross due to the high water and debris caught up in the fast flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 9.2 feet Friday morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning around 900 AM MDT.
